A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate on the plan of the Department of Defense and the Department of Energy for modernizing the nuclear weapons of the United States.
A resolution affirming the importance of the security and privacy of the people of the United States.
A resolution recognizing and commemorating the bicentennial of the State of Indiana.
A resolution designating the week of December 4 through December 10, 2016, as "National Nurse-Managed Health Clinic Week".
A resolution honoring the individuals who lost their lives in the tragic fire in Oakland, California, on December 2, 2016.
A resolution recognizing the 75th anniversary of the attack on Pearl Harbor and the lasting significance of National Pearl Harbor Remembrance Day.
A resolution designating December 17, 2016, as "Wreaths Across America Day".
A resolution congratulating the New England Patriots on their victory in Super Bowl XLIX.
A resolution recognizing the death of John Glenn, former Senator for the State of Ohio and the first individual from the United States to orbit the Earth.
A resolution celebrating the 200th anniversary of the Committee on the Judiciary of the Senate.

A resolution authorizing taking pictures and filming in the Senate Chamber, the Senate Wing of the United States Capitol, and Senate Office Buildings for production of a film and a book on the history of the Senate.
A resolution designating February 2 through 6, 2015, as "National School Counseling Week".
A resolution supporting efforts to bring an end to violence perpetrated by Boko Haram, and urging the Government of Nigeria to conduct transparent, peaceful, and credible elections.
A resolution expressing support for the designation of February 12, 2015, as "Darwin Day" and recognizing the importance of science in the betterment of humanity.
A resolution amending rule XXII of the Standing Rules of the Senate to revise the number of affirmative votes required to end debate on nominations.

A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate regarding the January 24, 2015, attacks carried out by Russian-backed rebels on the civilian population in Mariupol, Ukraine, and the provision of lethal and non-lethal military assistance to Ukraine.
A resolution calling for the protection of religious minority rights and freedoms worldwide.

A resolution expressing the thanks of the Senate to the Honorable Patrick J. Leahy for his service as President Pro Tempore of the United States Senate and to designate Senator Leahy as President Pro Tempore Emeritus of the United States Senate.
A resolution designating February 2015 as "National Carbon Monoxide Poisoning Awareness Month".
A resolution designating the week of February 8 through February 14, 2015, as "Internet Governance Awareness Week".

A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate regarding the January 24, 2015, attacks carried out by Russian-backed rebels on the civilian population in Mariupol, Ukraine, and the provision of defensive lethal and non-lethal military assistance to Ukraine.

An original resolution authorizing expenditures by committees of the Senate for the periods March 1, 2015 through September 30, 2015, October 1, 2015 through September 30, 2016, and October 1, 2016 through February 28, 2017.

A resolution declaring that achieving the primary goal of the National Plan to Address Alzheimer's Disease of the Department of Health and Human Services to prevent and effectively treat Alzheimer's disease by 2025 is an urgent national priority.
A resolution designating the month of February 2015, as "National Teen Dating Violence Awareness and Prevention Month".
A resolution welcoming the Prime Minister of Israel to the United States for his address to a joint meeting of Congress.
A resolution designating Friday, February 13, 2015, as "$2.13 Day".
A resolution relative to the death of Jerry Tarkanian, former head basketball coach of the University of Nevada, Las Vegas.
A resolution honoring Dean Edwards Smith, former head coach for the men's basketball team for the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill.
A resolution fixing the hour of daily meeting of the Senate.
A resolution recognizing the cultural and historical significance of Lunar New Year.

A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate that children trafficked for sex in the United States should not be treated or regarded as child prostitutes because there is no such thing as a "child prostitute", only children who are victims or survivors of rape and sex trafficking.
A resolution commending Kathleen Alvarez Tritak on her service to the United States Senate.
A resolution supporting the goals and ideals of the Secondary School Student Athletes' Bill of Rights.
A resolution celebrating Black History Month.
A resolution honoring the life and legacy of Georgia Jones-Ayers.
A resolution recognizing March 3, 2015, as the centennial of the Navy Reserve.

A resolution to express the sense of the Senate regarding the rise of anti-Semitism in Europe and to encourage greater cooperation with the European governments, the European Union, and the Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe in preventing and responding to anti-Semitism.
A resolution celebrating Black History Month.
A resolution congratulating the Oregon Shakespeare Festival on its 80th year.
A resolution electing Julie Adams as Secretary of the Senate.
A resolution designating February 2015 as "American Heart Month" and February 6, 2015, as "National Wear Red Day".
A resolution designating March 2, 2015, as "Read Across America Day".
A resolution designating February 28, 2015, as "Rare Disease Day".

A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate regarding the courageous work and life of Russian opposition leader Boris Nemtsov, and calling for a swift and transparent investigation into his tragic murder in Moscow on February 27, 2015.
A resolution supporting the goals and ideals of Career and Technical Education Month.
A resolution designating March 3, 2015, as "World Wildlife Day".
A resolution condemning the murder of Boris Nemtsov, and for other purposes.
A resolution supporting the goals of International Women's Day.
A resolution supporting the goals and ideals of Multiple Sclerosis Awareness Week.
A resolution calling on the Government of Iran to follow through on repeated promises of assistance in the case of Robert Levinson, the longest held United States civilian in our Nation's history.
